ccre.saver

Class StorageSegment

  • java.lang.Object
    • ccre.saver.StorageSegment
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    HashMappedStorageSegment

    public abstract class StorageSegment
extends java.lang.Object
    A storage segment - a place to store various pieces of data. One of these can be obtained using StorageProvider.
    See Also:
    StorageProvider

    • Method Detail

      • getBytesForKey

        public abstract byte[] getBytesForKey(java.lang.String key)
        Get raw bytes for the specified key. The return array is expected to not be modified! Create a copy if you need to change the data.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to look up.
        Returns:
        the byte data contained there, or null if the key doesn't exist.

      • getStringForKey

        public java.lang.String getStringForKey(java.lang.String key)
        Get a String value for the specified key.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to look up.
        Returns:
        the String contained there, or null if the key doesn't exist.

      • getDataInputForKey

        public java.io.DataInputStream getDataInputForKey(java.lang.String key)
        Get a DataInputStream that will read from the specified key. This creates a DataInputStream on a ByteArrayInputStream of the bytes stored in the key.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to look up.
        Returns:
        the DataInputStream to read from there, or null if the key doesn't exist.

      • setBytesForKey

        public abstract void setBytesForKey(java.lang.String key,
                  byte[] bytes)
        Set the byte data behind the specified key. Note: this method assumes that the byte array given will not be modified! Do not modify it after passing it!
        Parameters:
        key - the key to put the bytes under.
        bytes - the bytes to store under this key.

      • setStringForKey

        public void setStringForKey(java.lang.String key,
                   java.lang.String value)
        Set the string value behind the specified key.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to put the String under.
        value - the String to store under this key.

      • setDataOutputForKey

        public java.io.DataOutputStream setDataOutputForKey(java.lang.String key)
        Create a DataOutputStream to allow for easy writing of data to this key. You must close this stream, or the data will not save!
        Parameters:
        key - the key to store data under.
        Returns:
        the DataOutputStream to write data to.

      • flush

        public abstract void flush()
        Flush the segment. This attempts to make sure that all data is stored on disk (or somewhere else, depending on the provider). If this is not called, data might not be saved!

      • close

        public abstract void close()
        Close the segment. This includes flushing the segment if applicable. The segment may be unusable once this is called. Do not use the segment afterwards.

      • attachStringHolder

        public void attachStringHolder(java.lang.String name,
                      StringHolder holder)
        Attach a StringHolder to this storage segment. This will restore data if it has been stored as modified in the segment. This will save the data of the string holder as it updates, although you may need to call flush() to ensure that the data is saved. This will only overwrite the current value of the StringHolder if the data was saved when the StringHolder had the same default (value when this method is called). This means that you can modify the contents using either the StorageSegment or by changing the StringHolder's original value.
        Parameters:
        name - the name to save the holder under.
        holder - the holder to save.

      • attachFloatHolder

        public void attachFloatHolder(java.lang.String name,
                     FloatStatus holder)
        Attach a FloatHolder to this storage segment. This will restore data if it has been stored as modified in the segment. This will save the data of the float holder as it updates, although you may need to call flush() to ensure that the data is saved. This will only overwrite the current value of the FloatHolder if the data was saved when the FloatHolder had the same default (value when this method is called). This means that you can modify the contents using either the StorageSegment or by changing the FloatHolder's original value.
        Parameters:
        name - the name to save the holder under.
        holder - the holder to save.
